definition:
The [*quadratic resolvent*]{} of the cubic equation $$\begin{aligned}
y^3+py+q = 0,\end{aligned}$$ where $p$ and $q$ are known complex
numbers, is the auxiliary equation
$$z^2+qz-\left(\frac{p}{3}\right)^3 = 0$$ determining as its
$$z_1 = u^3, \qquad z_2 = v^3$$ the numbers $u$ and $v$ whose sum
$y = u+v$ satisfies the equation (1). See .

Analogically, a quartic equation has a [*cubic resolvent*]{} (resolvent
cubic) equation.
